DataElement.preferredName: Entire Non-Cytokine Release Syndrome Etiology Sign or Symptom Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the symptoms present were explained entirely by non-cytokine release syndrome cause.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Entire Non-Cytokine Release Syndrome Etiology Sign or Symptom Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A syndrome that occurs after therapeutic infusion of antibodies into the blood and is characterized by nausea, headache, tachycardia, hypotension, rash, and shortness of breath. It is caused by the release of cytokines from the cells that are targeted by the antibodies. Most patients experience a mild to moderate reaction; however, the reaction may be severe and life-threatening._The cause of a disease or abnormal condition._Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Whole Negation Cytokine Release Syndrome Etiology Sign or Symptom
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A syndrome that occurs after therapeutic infusion of antibodies into the blood and is characterized by nausea, headache, tachycardia, hypotension, rash, and shortness of breath. It is caused by the release of cytokines from the cells that are targeted by the antibodies. Most patients experience a mild to moderate reaction; however, the reaction may be severe and life-threatening.:The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A syndrome that occurs after therapeutic infusion of antibodies into the blood and is characterized by nausea, headache, tachycardia, hypotension, rash, and shortness of breath. It is caused by the release of cytokines from the cells that are targeted by the antibodies. Most patients experience a mild to moderate reaction; however, the reaction may be severe and life-threatening.
The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.
Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).
